title: Mork & Mindy
creator_credit: Henderson Productions, Miller-Milkis Productions, Paramount Television, Brian Levant, Garry Marshall, Anthony W. Marshall, Dale McRaven and Bruce Johnson
brief_description: Mork & Mindy is an American science fiction sitcom broadcast from 1978 until 1982. The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

creator_credit_for_label: Henderson Productions, Miller-Milkis Productions, Paramount Television, Brian Levant, Garry Marshall, Anthony W. Marshall, Dale McRaven and Bruce Johnson
description: Mork & Mindy is an American science fiction sitcom broadcast from 1978 until 1982 on ABC. The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship. Pam Dawber co-starred as Mindy McConnell, his human friend and roommate. In 1997, the episode “Mork’s Mixed Emotions” was ranked #94 on TV Guide’s 100 Greatest Episodes of All Time list.

The series starred Robin Williams as Mork, an alien who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in a small, one-man egg-shaped spaceship.
